meanings.definition: A person who aggressively seeks to catch or retrieve balls at sporting events.
meanings.sent1: The ballhawk at the baseball game caught every foul ball that came his way.
meanings.sent2: The young boy was known as the ballhawk of the soccer field for his impressive ball-catching skills.
meanings.sent3: The ballhawk at the basketball game even caught a ball that bounced off three different players!
meanings.sent4: She was a true ballhawk, swooping in to grab the baseball before anyone else could react.
meanings.sent5: The ballhawk's quick reflexes made them a valuable asset during the game.

meanings.definition: To aggressively pursue or go after something, especially in a competitive or determined manner.
meanings.sent1: He would ballhawk every opportunity to showcase his skills on the court.
meanings.sent2: The detective decided to ballhawk the suspect until he revealed the truth.
meanings.sent3: She would ballhawk any chance to prove she was the fastest runner in the school.
meanings.sent4: The ambitious entrepreneur would ballhawk every business opportunity that came her way.
meanings.sent5: The team captain encouraged his players to ballhawk victory with unwavering determination.
